attributes.action: Install CCTV cameras at bus stops
attributes.additional_details: I have been robbed/approached by people with intention to rob me at a bus stop multiple times now. On Saturday the 7th of November , my phone was stolen from me (at a bus stop )and I was coerced to pay £250 to the person robbing me in return for my phone. I strongly believe that if Cameras were in place at certain bus stops - we would see a decrease in events like this. I am sure there are many people in London who have been in similar situations as me. So please sign this petition to encourage change
attributes.background: Attempt to install CCTV cameras at bus stops stationed in desolate areas to prevent further robberies.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Installing CCTV equipment would be a matter for local councils, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
